description: From Middle English upthrowen, equivalent to up- +â€Ž throw.

entries.meaning: (geology) A fault in which a mass of material has been thrown up from below.

verbs.description: upthrow (third-person singular simple present upthrows, present participle upthrowing, simple past upthrew, past participle upthrown)

entries.meaning: (archaic, poetic) To throw or cast upwards.
examples: For fifty tons of water were upthrown / By them per hour [...].

entries.meaning: (geology, transitive) To throw up (a mass of material) from below, causing a fault.
(geology, intransitive, of a mass of material) To be thrown up from below, causing a fault.
